result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Joseph J Albert in court.  Attorney Jade K Hall in court for Joseph J Albert.  Attorney Samuel E. Simpson in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for a motion hearing.  Court vacates stayed bench warrant.  State requests an adjournment as the State's essential officer is not available.  Court rescheduled motion hearing.  Case adjourned to Branch 2, Rm 635 CH.
Motion hearing scheduled for December 8, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Received and Filed: Pretrial Services Supervision Report 09-29-2022

Defendant Joseph J Albert not in court.  Attorney Jade K Hall in court for Joseph J Albert.  Attorney Samuel E. Simpson in court for State of Wisconsin. Case in court for motion hearing. Defense advises defendant does not appear due to illness. State request stayed bench warrant. Court orders bench warrant, however stays the issue until next court date. Court grants adjournment of motion hearing. Case adjourned in Branch 2.
Motion hearing scheduled for September 29, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Received and filed. Justice Point Supervision Report. Deputy Court Clerk: EAB.

Defendant Joseph J Albert in court with attorney Jade K Hall.  Samuel E. Simpson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Case scheduled for final pretrial. Defense requests a motion hearing date. Court vacates 07-25-2022 jury trial. 
Defense motion to modify supervision from level 5 to level 3, argued. Court orders Justice Point supervision modified to level 4 with all previously ordered conditions.
Case adjourned, Branch 2.  Motion hearing scheduled for September 9, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defense requests a final pretrial and jury trial date. Case adjourned, Branch 2 via Zoom.  Final pre-trial scheduled for June 16, 2022 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for July 25, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Joseph J Albert in court with attorney Jade K Hall.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Hearing held via Zoom. Case scheduled for bail hearing to address JusticePoint violation/discharge. Defendant has regained contact and JusticePoint reinstated monitoring. State does not wish to address bail at this time. Court reminded defendant to maintain contact. Case remains calendared for scheduling conference 03-23-2022 at 1:30 pm , Branch 2 via Zoom.

Pretrial Services Status Report
Case scheduled for bail/bond hearing 02-16-2022 at 8:30 am by Zoom to address JusticePoint discharge. Parties notified.
Pretrial Services Discharge Report

Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Wagner.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Childs, Br. 02.

Defendant Joseph J Albert in court in person with Attorney Jade K Hall who appears by video.  Matthew Zisi appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Court took judicial notice of the defendants prior convictions & 21CT477. Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: Franklin Police Sgt. S. Patyk.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 02.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 23, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Pretrial Services Supervision VIOLATION Report; filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.  Scram bracelet ordered to monitor defendant maintains absolute sobriety.  Defendant to be monitored by portable breathalyzers.  No driving without a valid license.

Defendant Joseph J Albert in court with attorney Arial Jade Rosenberg.  Defendant Joseph J Albert in custody.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Joseph J Albert appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
